cause.description:
Net Literacy has increased computer literacy to over 60,000 individuals in four states. We have met with national leaders - from President Clinton to Colin Powell, and from Senator Bush to President Bush in a White House ceremony - to promote our cause. Net Literacy has hundreds of youth volunteers that have taught hundreds of seniors and underserved indiviudals computer and Internet skills. Net Literacy has increased awares of the digital divide, with articles and recognition in the NY Times, USA Today, the AARP Magazine, People Magazine, ABC TV's national network, Retirement TV, NPR, among many other television stations, radio stations, magazines, and newspapers.
1. Increase awareness of the digital divide
2. Increase computer access to the underserved.
3. Increase Internet safety awareness.
4. Promote youth philanthropy in a youth empowered organization.
cause.mission: The mission of Net Literacy is to empower youths, promote youth philanthropy, increase computer access, increase computer and Internet literacy, enhance communities understanding of Internet safety
cause.name: Net Literacy
